name: first-peace-treaty
description: Egypt and the Hittites signed the earliest known peace treaty after the Battle of Kadesh.

name: persian-empire-cyrus
description: Cyrus the Great founded the Achaemenid Empire, the first Persian Empire.

name: cyrus-cylinder
description: Cyrus the Great issued an early declaration of human rights after conquering Babylon.

name: roman-republic
description: Rome overthrew its monarchy and established a republican government.

name: athenian-democracy
description: Cleisthenes introduced democratic reforms in ancient Athens.

name: delian-league
description: Greek city-states formed an alliance led by Athens against the Persian Empire.

name: twelve-tables
description: Rome codified its first written laws, forming the foundation of Roman legal tradition.

name: league-corinth
description: Philip II united Greek city-states in an alliance against Persia.

name: maurya-empire
description: Chandragupta Maurya established the first empire to unify most of India.

name: ashoka-edicts
description: Indian emperor Ashoka proclaimed religious tolerance and non-violence.

name: punic-treaty
description: Rome and Carthage signed a treaty ending 23 years of conflict over Sicily.

name: qin-unification
description: Qin Shi Huang unified China and became its first emperor.

name: han-dynasty
description: The Han Dynasty established the golden age of Chinese civilization.

name: treaty-apamea
description: Rome imposed terms on the Seleucid Empire after defeating Antiochus III.

name: silk-road-opens
description: Trade routes connecting China to the Mediterranean were established.

name: roman-empire-founded
description: Augustus became the first Roman Emperor, ending the Republic.

name: pax-romana
description: Augustus established a 200-year period of relative peace across the Roman Empire.

name: edict-caracalla
description: Roman citizenship was extended to all free inhabitants of the empire.

name: diocletian-tetrarchy
description: Emperor Diocletian created the Tetrarchy to govern the vast Roman Empire.

name: edict-milan
description: Emperor Constantine legalized Christianity throughout the Roman Empire.

name: gupta-empire
description: The Gupta Empire began India's golden age of science and culture.

name: council-nicaea
description: The first ecumenical council established key Christian doctrines.

name: theodosian-code
description: The Eastern Roman Empire compiled all imperial laws since Constantine.

name: justinian-code
description: Byzantine Emperor Justinian codified Roman law, influencing legal systems for centuries.

name: tang-dynasty
description: The Tang Dynasty began China's golden age of culture and governance.

name: constitution-medina
description: The Prophet Muhammad established a political agreement unifying Medina's diverse groups.

name: umayyad-caliphate
description: The first hereditary Islamic dynasty established its capital in Damascus.

name: abbasid-caliphate
description: The Abbasids overthrew the Umayyads and moved the capital to Baghdad.

name: papal-states-established
description: The Pope received territories in central Italy from the Frankish king.

name: treaty-verdun
description: Charlemagne's empire was divided into three kingdoms, shaping medieval Europe.

name: treaty-wedmore
description: Alfred the Great made peace with Viking leader Guthrum, dividing England.

name: song-dynasty
description: The Song Dynasty ushered in an era of technological innovation and economic growth.

name: holy-roman-empire
description: Otto I was crowned, establishing the Holy Roman Empire in central Europe.

name: capetian-dynasty
description: Hugh Capet founded the dynasty that would rule France for 800 years.

name: concordat-worms
description: The Pope and Holy Roman Emperor resolved the Investiture Controversy.

name: fourth-crusade-constantinople
description: The Fourth Crusade diverted to sack the Byzantine capital.

name: magna-carta
description: English barons forced King John to sign a charter limiting royal power.

name: hanseatic-league
description: Northern German cities formed a commercial alliance dominating Baltic trade.

name: english-parliament
description: Simon de Montfort summoned the first elected parliament in England.

name: mongol-empire
description: The Mongol Empire became the largest contiguous land empire in history.

name: swiss-confederation
description: Three Swiss cantons formed an alliance that became modern Switzerland.

name: ottoman-empire-founded
description: Osman I established the dynasty that would rule for over 600 years.

name: golden-bull
description: The decree established how Holy Roman Emperors would be elected.

name: ming-dynasty
description: The Ming Dynasty restored Chinese rule after Mongol domination.

name: union-krewo
description: Poland and Lithuania formed a personal union through royal marriage.

name: union-kalmar
description: Denmark, Norway, and Sweden united under a single monarch.

name: aztec-empire
description: The Triple Alliance formed the Aztec Empire in central Mexico.

name: treaty-alcacovas
description: Spain and Portugal divided Atlantic territories before Columbus's voyage.

name: inca-empire-peak
description: The Inca Empire reached its greatest extent in South America.

name: treaty-tordesillas
description: Spain and Portugal divided the newly discovered lands outside Europe.

name: league-cambrai
description: Major European powers allied against Venice's territorial expansion.

name: treaty-madrid
description: Captured French King Francis I ceded territories to Emperor Charles V.

name: mughal-empire
description: Babur founded the dynasty that would rule most of India for 300 years.

name: church-of-england
description: Henry VIII broke from Rome and established the Anglican Church.

name: peace-augsburg
description: The treaty allowed German princes to choose Catholicism or Lutheranism for their states.

name: peace-cateau-cambresis
description: France and Spain ended decades of Italian Wars with a comprehensive treaty.

name: union-utrecht
description: Northern Dutch provinces formed a defensive union against Spain.

name: dutch-republic
description: The Netherlands declared independence from Spanish rule.

name: edict-nantes
description: Henry IV granted religious tolerance to French Protestants.

name: east-india-company
description: England chartered the company that would dominate trade with Asia.

name: tokugawa-shogunate
description: The Tokugawa clan unified Japan and began 250 years of isolation and peace.

name: treaty-london-anglo-spanish
description: England and Spain ended nearly two decades of war.

name: jamestown-founded
description: The first permanent English settlement in America was established.

name: mayflower-compact
description: Pilgrims created an early form of self-government in America.

name: qing-dynasty
description: The Manchu Qing Dynasty conquered Ming China and would rule for nearly three centuries.

name: peace-pyrenees
description: France and Spain ended 24 years of war, establishing French dominance.

name: treaty-breda
description: England gained New Amsterdam (New York) from the Dutch.

name: treaty-nijmegen
description: A series of treaties ended the Franco-Dutch War.

name: habeas-corpus
description: England enshrined the right to challenge unlawful imprisonment.

name: bill-of-rights-england
description: Parliament established constitutional limits on the monarchy.

name: bank-of-england
description: The world's second oldest central bank was established.

name: treaty-ryswick
description: The treaty ended the Nine Years' War between France and the Grand Alliance.

name: act-of-union-britain
friendly_name: Acts of Union Create Great Britain
description: England and Scotland united to form the Kingdom of Great Britain.

name: statute-of-anne
description: The Statute of Anne, the first law regulating copyright, came into force in Great Britain.

name: treaty-utrecht
description: The treaties ending the War of Spanish Succession reshaped European power.

name: treaty-aix-la-chapelle
description: The treaty ended the War of Austrian Succession.

name: treaty-paris-seven-years
description: The treaty ended the Seven Years' War and reshaped colonial empires worldwide.

name: partition-poland
description: Russia, Prussia, and Austria carved up Polish territory.

name: articles-confederation
description: The first constitution of the United States was ratified.

name: constitutional-convention
description: Delegates gathered in Philadelphia to draft the US Constitution.

name: us-constitution
description: The United States adopted its constitution establishing the federal government.

name: first-fleet-australia
description: British ships established a penal colony at Sydney Cove.

name: french-declaration-rights
friendly_name: Declaration of the Rights of Man
description: Revolutionary France proclaimed fundamental rights and freedoms.

name: dc-established
description: The District of Columbia was established as the U.S. capital after the Residence Act was signed.

name: bill-of-rights-us
description: The first ten amendments to the US Constitution were adopted.

name: library-congress-established
description: President John Adams signed legislation establishing the Library of Congress.

name: louisiana-purchase
description: The United States bought vast territories from France, doubling its size.

name: haitian-independence
description: Haiti became the first nation founded by a successful slave revolt.

name: congress-vienna
description: European powers redrew the map after Napoleon's defeat.

name: concert-europe
description: Great powers agreed to maintain stability and suppress revolution.

name: missouri-compromise
description: Congress balanced free and slave states while admitting Missouri.

name: latin-american-independence
description: Mexico and other Spanish colonies gained independence in rapid succession.

name: monroe-doctrine
description: The US opposed European colonization in the Americas.

name: bolivia-independence
description: The Bolivian Declaration of Independence was proclaimed.

name: belgian-independence
description: Belgium gained independence from the Netherlands after revolution.

name: indian-removal-act
description: President Andrew Jackson signed the Indian Removal Act, forcibly relocating Native Americans.

name: treaty-waitangi
description: Britain and Māori chiefs signed the founding document of New Zealand.

name: treaty-nanking
description: China ceded Hong Kong to Britain after the First Opium War.

name: compromise-slavery
description: Congress attempted to balance free and slave state interests as US territories expanded.

name: red-cross-founded
description: Henry Dunant established the humanitarian organization in Geneva.

name: emancipation-proclamation
description: Lincoln declared slaves in Confederate states to be free.

name: geneva-convention-first
description: Nations agreed to protect wounded soldiers and medical personnel in war.

name: 13th-amendment
description: The United States abolished slavery through constitutional amendment.

name: dominion-canada
description: Canadian provinces united to form a self-governing dominion within the British Empire.

name: british-north-america-act
description: The act created the Dominion of Canada from British colonies.

name: meiji-restoration
description: Japan restored imperial rule and began rapid modernization.

name: triple-alliance
description: Germany, Austria-Hungary, and Italy formed a mutual defense pact.

name: berlin-conference
description: European powers divided Africa among themselves without African participation.

name: first-zionist-congress
description: Theodor Herzl organized the movement for a Jewish homeland.

name: hague-conventions
description: International treaties established rules of warfare and peaceful dispute resolution.

name: commonwealth-australia
description: Australian colonies federated to form a single nation.

name: entente-cordiale
description: Britain and France signed agreements ending centuries of rivalry.

name: triple-entente
description: Britain, France, and Russia aligned against the Triple Alliance.

name: naacp-founded
description: The civil rights organization was established to fight racial discrimination.

name: chinese-republic
description: The Qing Dynasty fell and China became a republic.

name: anc-founded
description: The ANC was founded as the South African Native National Congress to fight for Black rights.

name: last-emperor-china-abdicates
description: The Xuantong Emperor abdicated, ending over 2,000 years of imperial rule in China.

name: ilo-founded
description: The ILO was created to promote workers' rights worldwide.

name: league-of-nations
description: The first international organization for world peace was established.

name: womens-suffrage-us
description: American women gained the constitutional right to vote.

name: treaty-versailles-effect
description: The Treaty of Versailles officially ended World War I for most combatant nations.

name: prohibition-begins-us
description: Alcohol prohibition began in the United States as the Volstead Act took effect.

name: irish-free-state
description: Ireland gained independence from Britain as a dominion.

name: ussr-formed
description: The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics was officially established.

name: washington-naval-treaty
description: Major powers agreed to limit their naval fleets to prevent an arms race.

name: anglo-irish-treaty
description: Dail Eireann ratified the Anglo-Irish Treaty by 64-57 vote, establishing the Irish Free State.

name: dawes-plan
description: The plan restructured German reparations payments after World War I.

name: locarno-treaties
description: European nations agreed to mutual borders and peaceful relations.

name: kellogg-briand-pact
description: Nations agreed to renounce war as an instrument of national policy.

name: statute-westminster
description: British dominions gained legislative independence from the UK Parliament.

name: kingdom-saudi-arabia-founded
description: Ibn Saud unified the Arabian Peninsula into a single kingdom.

name: manchukuo-established
description: Japan created the puppet state of Manchukuo in Manchuria, installing former Chinese Emperor Puyi.

name: new-deal
description: FDR launched sweeping programs to combat the Great Depression.

name: social-security-act
description: The US established its social insurance program for the elderly.

name: anti-comintern-pact
description: Germany and Japan agreed to oppose international communism.

name: rhineland-remilitarization
description: In violation of Versailles and Locarno treaties, Germany remilitarized the Rhineland.

name: atlantic-charter
description: Churchill and Roosevelt outlined Allied war aims and postwar goals.

name: declaration-united-nations
description: Twenty-six nations signed the Declaration by United Nations during World War II.

name: imf-world-bank
description: The Bretton Woods Conference created the international financial institutions.

name: united-nations-founded
description: Fifty-one nations established the international organization for peace and cooperation.

name: yalta-conference
description: Allied leaders met to plan the postwar reorganization of Europe.

name: potsdam-conference
description: Allied leaders finalized postwar arrangements for Germany and Europe.

name: first-un-general-assembly
description: The first General Assembly of the United Nations assembles in London with 51 nations represented.

name: indian-independence
description: India gained independence from British rule and was partitioned with Pakistan.

name: marshall-plan
description: The US announced massive economic aid to rebuild Western Europe.

name: gatt-established
description: Nations agreed to reduce tariffs and promote free trade.

name: universal-declaration-rights
description: The United Nations adopted the landmark document on human rights.

name: israel-founded
description: Israel declared independence as a Jewish homeland.

name: berlin-airlift
description: Western powers supplied West Berlin by air during the Soviet blockade.

name: burma-independence
description: Burma gains independence from the United Kingdom, becoming the Union of Burma.

name: nato-founded
description: Western nations formed a military alliance for collective defense.

name: geneva-conventions-modern
description: Nations adopted comprehensive humanitarian law for armed conflicts.

name: prc-founded
description: Mao Zedong proclaimed the founding of communist China.

name: indian-constitution-enacted
description: The Constitution of India comes into force, forming a republic with Rajendra Prasad as first President.

name: european-coal-steel
description: Six nations created the first European supranational organization.

name: elizabeth-ii-becomes-queen
description: Elizabeth II becomes Queen of the United Kingdom upon the death of her father, George VI.

name: brown-v-board
description: The Supreme Court ruled school segregation unconstitutional.

name: seato-formed
description: Southeast Asian nations formed a collective defense treaty with Western powers.

name: warsaw-pact
description: The Soviet Union and Eastern Bloc formed a military alliance.

name: bandung-conference
description: African and Asian nations met to promote cooperation and oppose colonialism.

name: sudan-independence
description: Sudan achieves independence from Egypt and the United Kingdom.

name: treaty-rome
description: Six nations created the European Economic Community.

name: efta-formed
description: Seven European nations formed a free trade alternative to the EEC.

name: opec-founded
description: Oil-producing nations formed a cartel to control petroleum prices.

name: decolonization-africa
description: Seventeen African nations gained independence from European colonial powers.

name: indus-water-treaty
description: India and Pakistan signed a water-sharing treaty brokered by the World Bank.

name: us-japan-mutual-security-treaty
description: Japan and the United States sign the Mutual Security Treaty.

name: non-aligned-movement
description: Nations refused to align with either Cold War superpower bloc.

name: cuban-missile-resolution
description: The US and USSR reached an agreement to remove missiles from Cuba and Turkey.

name: test-ban-treaty
description: The US, UK, and USSR agreed to ban nuclear tests in the atmosphere.

name: civil-rights-act
description: The US outlawed discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

name: 24th-amendment-ratified
description: The 24th Amendment, prohibiting poll taxes in national elections, is ratified.

name: voting-rights-act
description: The US prohibited racial discrimination in voting.

name: singapore-independence
description: Singapore separated from Malaysia to become an independent nation.

name: apollo-11-treaty
description: Nations agreed that space should be free for exploration and cannot be claimed.

name: asean-founded
description: Five Southeast Asian nations formed an association for regional cooperation.

name: nuclear-non-proliferation
description: Nations agreed to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons.

name: china-un-seat
description: The People's Republic of China replaced Taiwan on the UN Security Council.

name: nixon-china
description: President Nixon's visit opened diplomatic relations between the US and China.

name: salt-i
description: The US and USSR signed the first Strategic Arms Limitation Treaty.

name: paris-peace-accords-1973
description: The agreement led to a ceasefire and U.S. withdrawal from Vietnam.

name: helsinki-accords
description: East and West agreed on security, cooperation, and human rights.

name: camp-david-accords
description: Egypt and Israel signed a peace agreement brokered by the US.

name: reform-opening-china
description: Deng Xiaoping launched economic reforms that transformed China into a market economy.

name: iran-revolution
description: Iran became an Islamic theocracy after the revolution.

name: salt-ii
description: The US and USSR agreed to further limits on nuclear weapons.

name: egypt-israel-peace
description: Egypt became the first Arab nation to sign a peace treaty with Israel.

name: solidarity-poland
description: Polish workers formed the first independent labor union in a Soviet bloc country.

name: constitution-canada-patriation
description: Canada gained full sovereignty with the ability to amend its own constitution.

name: european-union-precursor
description: European nations agreed to create a single market.

name: start-i
description: The US and USSR signed the first Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty.

name: maastricht-treaty
description: The treaty created the European Union and planned a common currency.

name: nafta-signed
description: The North American Free Trade Agreement created a trade bloc between the US, Canada, and Mexico.

name: oslo-accords
description: Israel and the PLO signed agreements toward Palestinian self-governance.

name: wto-founded
description: The international organization for trade rules and negotiations was established.

name: dayton-accords
description: The agreement ended the war in Bosnia and Herzegovina.

name: schengen-area
description: European nations abolished border controls for passport-free travel.

name: kyoto-protocol
description: Nations agreed to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to combat climate change.

name: hong-kong-handover
description: Britain returned Hong Kong to China after 156 years of colonial rule.

name: good-friday-agreement
description: A peace agreement largely ended decades of conflict in Northern Ireland.

name: rome-statute-icc
description: Nations agreed to establish the International Criminal Court.

name: euro-introduced
description: Eleven European nations adopted a common currency.

name: macau-handover
description: Portugal returned Macau to China after over 400 years of colonial rule.

name: china-wto-entry
description: China joined the World Trade Organization, accelerating its global economic integration.

name: icc-established
description: The first permanent international court for war crimes was established.

name: african-union
description: African nations formed a continental union for political and economic integration.

name: eu-eastern-expansion
description: Ten countries joined the European Union in its largest single expansion.

name: same-sex-marriage-canada
description: Canada became the fourth country to legalize same-sex marriage nationwide.

name: asean-charter
description: Southeast Asian nations adopted a charter giving ASEAN legal status.

name: lisbon-treaty
description: The EU reformed its institutions and created a permanent president.

name: belt-road-initiative
description: China announced a massive global infrastructure investment strategy.

name: paris-climate-agreement
description: Nearly 200 nations agreed to limit global warming to well below 2°C.

name: iran-nuclear-deal
description: World powers reached an agreement to limit Iran's nuclear program.

name: inter-korean-summit-2018
description: Leaders of North and South Korea met for the first time in over a decade.

name: brexit
description: The United Kingdom officially left the European Union.

name: abraham-accords
description: UAE and Bahrain normalized relations with Israel.

name: lend-lease-act
description: The US began supplying Allied nations with military aid before entering World War II.

name: treaty-paris-1783
description: Britain formally recognized American independence, ending the Revolutionary War.

name: delhi-sultanate
description: Qutb ud-Din Aibak founded the first of five dynasties that ruled northern India.

name: british-raj-established
description: The British Crown assumed direct control of India after the Sepoy Mutiny.

name: german-reunification
description: East and West Germany united into a single nation after the fall of the Berlin Wall.

name: montreal-protocol
description: Nations agreed to phase out ozone-depleting substances in the most successful environmental treaty.

name: thatcher-becomes-pm
description: Britain's first female Prime Minister began transforming British politics and economics.

name: unification-egypt
friendly_name: Unification of Upper and Lower Egypt
description: Narmer unified Egypt under the First Dynasty, creating one of the world's first nation-states.

name: zhou-dynasty-begins
description: The Zhou overthrew the Shang, beginning China's longest-lasting dynasty.

name: darius-i-persian-king
description: Darius I seized the throne and expanded the Persian Empire to its greatest extent.

name: first-secession-plebs
description: Roman plebeians withdrew from the city, winning political representation through tribunes.

name: athens-surrenders-sparta
description: Athens surrendered after the Peloponnesian War, ending its golden age of democracy.

name: battle-chaeronea
description: Philip II of Macedon defeated Athens and Thebes, gaining control over Greece.

name: death-alexander-great
description: Alexander died in Babylon at 32, leaving his vast empire without a clear successor.

name: ptolemaic-kingdom-established
description: Ptolemy I founded a Greek dynasty in Egypt that would rule until Cleopatra's death.

name: seleucid-empire-founded
description: Seleucus I established an empire spanning from Anatolia to the borders of India.

name: battle-ipsus
description: The Diadochi fought a decisive battle that divided Alexander's empire among his successors.

name: lex-hortensia
description: This law gave the Plebeian Council full legislative power, equalizing Roman social classes.

name: tiberius-gracchus-reforms
description: Tiberius Gracchus proposed radical land reforms, triggering political violence in Rome.

name: marian-reforms
description: Gaius Marius professionalized the Roman army, allowing landless citizens to serve.

name: social-war-rome
description: Italian allies rebelled against Rome, eventually winning Roman citizenship.

name: sullas-civil-war
description: Sulla marched on Rome and became dictator, setting a precedent for later strongmen.

name: first-triumvirate
description: Caesar, Pompey, and Crassus formed an informal alliance to dominate Roman politics.

name: second-triumvirate
description: Octavian, Antony, and Lepidus formed a legal dictatorship to avenge Caesar's death.

name: death-of-augustus
description: Rome's first emperor died after 40 years of rule, establishing the model for succession.

name: nero-becomes-emperor
description: The young Nero became emperor, beginning a reign that would end in tyranny and suicide.

name: trajan-becomes-emperor
description: Trajan became emperor, expanding Rome to its greatest territorial extent.

name: hadrian-becomes-emperor
description: Hadrian succeeded Trajan, consolidating the empire and building his famous wall in Britain.

name: marcus-aurelius-emperor
description: The philosopher-emperor Marcus Aurelius began his reign, the last of the Five Good Emperors.

name: jin-dynasty-reunifies-china
description: The Jin Dynasty ended the Three Kingdoms period, briefly reunifying China.

name: fall-western-jin
description: Northern China fell to nomadic invaders, beginning centuries of division.

name: council-of-constantinople
description: Church council affirmed the Nicene Creed and defined the doctrine of the Trinity.

name: division-roman-empire
description: The Roman Empire permanently split into Western and Eastern halves after Theodosius's death.

name: ravenna-becomes-capital
description: The Western Roman capital moved from Milan to Ravenna for better defense.

name: council-of-ephesus
description: Church council declared Mary the 'Mother of God' and condemned Nestorianism.

name: death-of-muhammad
description: The Prophet Muhammad died in Medina, sparking debates over succession that still echo today.

name: islamic-conquest-spain
description: Umayyad forces crossed into Iberia, beginning nearly 800 years of Muslim presence in Spain.

name: charlemagne-king-franks
description: Charlemagne became sole king of the Franks, beginning his path to reuniting Western Europe.

name: death-of-charlemagne
description: Charlemagne died, and his empire was eventually divided among his grandsons.

name: alfred-great-king
description: Alfred became King of Wessex and would defend England against Viking invasion.

name: fall-tang-dynasty
description: China's Tang Dynasty collapsed, beginning the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period.

name: fatimid-caliphate-established
description: The Shia Fatimid dynasty established a caliphate in North Africa.

name: treaty-saint-clair-sur-epte
description: Vikings received Normandy from the French king, founding the Norman dynasty.

name: canute-king-england
description: The Danish king Canute conquered England, ruling a North Sea empire.

name: seljuk-empire-founded
description: The Seljuk Turks established an empire that would dominate the Middle East.

name: death-genghis-khan
description: Genghis Khan died, leaving an empire that would continue expanding under his successors.

name: model-parliament
description: Edward I summoned a parliament including commoners, establishing a template for representative government.

name: philip-vi-france
friendly_name: Philip VI Becomes King of France
description: The first Valois king's accession sparked the succession crisis that led to the Hundred Years' War.

name: treaty-of-bretigny
description: England and France agreed to a temporary peace, with England gaining territory in exchange for renouncing claims to the French throne.

name: marriage-ferdinand-isabella
description: The union of Aragon and Castile's heirs laid the foundation for a unified Spain.

name: henry-viii-becomes-king
description: The 17-year-old Tudor prince inherited England's throne, beginning a transformative reign.

name: charles-v-king-spain
friendly_name: Charles V Becomes King of Spain
description: The Habsburg prince inherited Spain, beginning an empire on which the sun never set.

name: charles-v-holy-roman-emperor
friendly_name: Charles V Elected Holy Roman Emperor
description: Charles V's election united Spain, the Netherlands, Austria, and the Holy Roman Empire under one ruler.

name: field-of-cloth-of-gold
friendly_name: Field of the Cloth of Gold
description: Henry VIII and Francis I met in an extravagant diplomatic summit that failed to secure lasting alliance.

name: neanderthals-thrive-europe
description: Neanderthals dominated Europe for over 200,000 years, developing sophisticated tools and social structures before modern humans arrived.

name: first-irrigation-systems
description: Ancient Mesopotamians developed canal systems to control water flow, enabling large-scale agriculture and the rise of civilization.

name: minoan-civilization-peak
description: The Minoan civilization on Crete reached its height, building elaborate palaces like Knossos and dominating Aegean trade.

name: abrahams-journey-traditional
description: According to tradition, Abraham migrated from Ur to Canaan, establishing the covenant that founded the Abrahamic faiths.

name: david-establishes-jerusalem-capital
description: King David captured Jerusalem from the Jebusites and made it the political and religious capital of the united Israelite kingdom.

name: assyrian-empire-expansion
description: The Neo-Assyrian Empire began aggressive expansion, becoming the first true empire to rule much of the ancient Near East.

name: fall-of-israel-northern-kingdom
description: Assyria conquered the northern Kingdom of Israel, deporting its population and ending the Ten Tribes as a distinct entity.

name: fall-of-nineveh
description: A coalition of Babylonians and Medes destroyed Nineveh, ending the Assyrian Empire after centuries of dominance.

name: caesar-invades-britain
description: Julius Caesar led two expeditions to Britain, the first Roman military operations on the island, though no permanent conquest resulted.

name: five-good-emperors-era-begins
description: Nerva's accession began Rome's most stable period, with emperors chosen by merit rather than heredity for nearly a century.

name: end-of-pax-romana
description: The death of Marcus Aurelius ended two centuries of relative peace and prosperity, beginning Rome's slow decline.

name: visigoths-settle-aquitaine
description: Rome granted the Visigoths land in southwestern Gaul as foederati, establishing the first Germanic kingdom within the empire.

name: theodoric-establishes-ostrogothic-kingdom
description: Theodoric the Great conquered Italy and established the Ostrogothic Kingdom, preserving Roman institutions under Gothic rule.

name: baghdad-founded
description: Caliph al-Mansur founded Baghdad as the new Abbasid capital, which became the world's largest city and center of learning.

name: treaty-of-aachen
description: The Byzantine Empire recognized Charlemagne as Emperor of the West, acknowledging the permanent division of the Roman legacy.

name: rurik-founds-novgorod
description: The Varangian prince Rurik established rule at Novgorod, founding the dynasty that would rule Russia for over 700 years.

name: fatimids-conquer-egypt
description: The Fatimid Caliphate conquered Egypt and founded Cairo, establishing a rival Shia caliphate to challenge Abbasid authority.

name: seljuk-turks-capture-baghdad
description: The Seljuk Turks entered Baghdad and became the real power behind the Abbasid caliphs, reshaping the Islamic world.

name: investiture-controversy-begins
description: Pope Gregory VII and Emperor Henry IV clashed over the right to appoint church officials, sparking a decades-long power struggle.

name: walk-to-canossa
description: Emperor Henry IV stood barefoot in the snow for three days seeking Pope Gregory VII's forgiveness after excommunication.

name: toledo-reconquered
description: Alfonso VI of Castile captured Toledo, a major Reconquista victory that recovered the former Visigothic capital from Muslim rule.

name: fall-of-edessa
description: Zengi captured the Crusader County of Edessa, the first Crusader state to fall, triggering the Second Crusade.

name: minamoto-yoritomo-becomes-shogun
description: Minamoto Yoritomo was named shogun, establishing the Kamakura shogunate and beginning seven centuries of samurai rule in Japan.

name: mamluks-take-power-egypt
description: The Mamluks, former slave soldiers, seized power in Egypt and would later halt the Mongol advance at Ain Jalut.

name: sicilian-vespers
description: A popular uprising in Palermo led to the massacre of French Angevins, ending French rule and bringing Aragon to power in Sicily.

name: henry-iv-deposes-richard-ii
description: Henry Bolingbroke deposed Richard II and became Henry IV, founding the Lancastrian dynasty and setting the stage for civil war.

name: council-of-florence
description: The Council attempted to reunite the Eastern and Western churches, briefly achieving union before Byzantine rejection.

name: portuguese-capture-goa
description: Afonso de Albuquerque conquered Goa, establishing it as the capital of Portuguese India and a major trading hub for four centuries.

name: augsburg-confession
description: Lutheran princes presented their confession of faith to Emperor Charles V, formally establishing Protestant doctrine.

name: pizarro-executes-atahualpa
description: Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro executed the Inca emperor Atahualpa despite receiving history's largest ransom.

name: dissolution-of-monasteries
description: Henry VIII began dissolving English monasteries, seizing their wealth and redistributing lands to loyal supporters.

name: servetus-burned-at-stake
description: Michael Servetus was burned for heresy in Calvin's Geneva for denying the Trinity, showing Protestant intolerance of dissent.

name: mercator-projection-map
description: Gerardus Mercator published his world map with a new projection that enabled straight-line navigation, revolutionizing seafaring.

name: execution-mary-queen-scots
friendly_name: Execution of Mary Queen of Scots
description: Elizabeth I executed her Catholic cousin Mary Stuart after years of imprisonment, removing a rival claimant to the English throne.

name: first-korean-turtle-ships
description: Admiral Yi Sun-sin deployed armored turtle ships against the Japanese navy, helping Korea resist Toyotomi Hideyoshi's invasion.

name: giordano-bruno-burned
description: The philosopher Giordano Bruno was burned at the stake in Rome for heresy, including his belief in an infinite universe.

name: gunpowder-plot
description: Guy Fawkes and Catholic conspirators attempted to blow up Parliament and King James I, but the plot was discovered and foiled.

name: defenestration-of-prague
description: Protestant nobles threw Catholic officials from a window in Prague Castle, sparking the Thirty Years' War.

name: great-migration-massachusetts
description: Over 20,000 Puritans migrated to Massachusetts Bay Colony in a decade, establishing English Protestant settlements in New England.

name: galileos-trial
description: The Inquisition tried Galileo for supporting heliocentrism, forcing him to recant and placing him under house arrest for life.

name: putney-debates
description: New Model Army officers and soldiers debated England's future constitution, with radicals arguing for expanded voting rights.

name: treaty-of-pereyaslav
description: Ukrainian Cossacks agreed to Russian protection, beginning the process that would bring Ukraine under Muscovite control.

name: royal-society-founded
description: Scientists founded the Royal Society of London, the world's oldest national scientific institution still in existence.

name: kangxi-emperor-begins-reign
description: The Kangxi Emperor began his 61-year reign, the longest in Chinese history, consolidating Qing rule and expanding the empire.

name: hudsons-bay-company-founded
description: Charles II granted a royal charter creating the Hudson's Bay Company, which would control much of North American fur trade.

name: pennsylvania-founded
description: William Penn received a charter for Pennsylvania, establishing it as a Quaker colony with religious tolerance and fair Native treaties.

name: salem-witch-trials
description: Mass hysteria in colonial Massachusetts led to the execution of twenty people accused of witchcraft before sanity prevailed.

name: treaty-of-rastatt
description: Austria and France ended the War of Spanish Succession, with Austria gaining the Spanish Netherlands and Italian territories.

name: first-freemason-grand-lodge
description: Four London lodges formed the first Grand Lodge of Freemasonry, beginning the organization's formal institutional structure.

name: south-sea-bubble
description: The South Sea Company's stock collapsed after massive speculation, ruining investors and causing Britain's first financial crisis.

name: robert-walpole-first-pm
description: Robert Walpole became First Lord of the Treasury, effectively creating the role of Prime Minister in British government.

name: treaty-of-nystad
description: Russia and Sweden ended the Great Northern War, with Russia gaining Baltic territories and emerging as a major European power.

name: first-saudi-state-established
description: Muhammad ibn Saud allied with Islamic reformer Muhammad ibn Abd al-Wahhab, founding the first Saudi state in Arabia.

name: black-hole-of-calcutta
description: British prisoners allegedly died in an overcrowded cell in Calcutta, becoming propaganda justifying British conquest of Bengal.

name: rousseaus-social-contract
description: Jean-Jacques Rousseau published his influential political philosophy arguing that legitimate rule requires popular consent.

name: stamp-act
description: Britain imposed direct taxation on American colonies, sparking protests and the slogan 'no taxation without representation.'

name: france-enters-american-revolution
description: France formally allied with the American colonies against Britain, providing crucial military and financial support for independence.

name: watts-rotary-steam-engine
description: James Watt patented the rotary steam engine, enabling steam power to drive machinery and accelerating the Industrial Revolution.

name: us-constitution-written
description: Delegates in Philadelphia drafted the US Constitution, creating a federal system with separation of powers still in use today.

name: tennis-court-oath
description: French National Assembly members swore not to disband until they had written a constitution, defying royal authority.

name: first-bank-united-states
friendly_name: First Bank of the United States
description: Alexander Hamilton established the First Bank of the United States to manage government finances and stabilize the economy.

name: execution-of-robespierre
description: Maximilien Robespierre was guillotined during the Thermidorian Reaction, ending the Terror and the radical phase of the Revolution.

name: malthus-essay-population
description: Thomas Malthus argued that population growth would outpace food supply, influencing economics and Darwin's evolution theory.

name: napoleons-egyptian-campaign
description: Napoleon invaded Egypt to threaten British India, bringing scientists who discovered the Rosetta Stone during the expedition.

name: act-of-union-ireland
description: Britain and Ireland merged their parliaments, creating the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

name: peace-of-amiens
description: Brief peace treaty between Britain and France ending the French Revolutionary Wars temporarily before hostilities resumed.

name: code-napoleon
description: French civil code established by Napoleon that influenced legal systems worldwide and remains the basis of French law.

name: fultons-steamboat
description: Robert Fulton's Clermont made the first commercially successful steamboat voyage on the Hudson River.

name: venezuela-declares-independence
description: Venezuela became the first South American nation to declare independence from Spain, beginning the continent's liberation.

name: burning-of-moscow
description: Moscow was set ablaze as Napoleon's army occupied the city, denying French forces shelter and contributing to their defeat.

name: treaty-of-ghent
description: Peace treaty ending the War of 1812 between the United States and Britain, restoring pre-war boundaries.

name: chile-independence
description: Chile formally declared independence from Spain after the Battle of Maipú secured liberation from colonial rule.

name: first-atlantic-steamship-crossing
description: The SS Savannah became the first steamship to cross the Atlantic Ocean, though it used sails for most of the voyage.

name: mexican-independence
description: Mexico gained independence from Spain after an eleven-year war, establishing the First Mexican Empire.

name: brazil-independence
description: Prince Pedro declared Brazil's independence from Portugal, becoming Emperor Pedro I of the new Brazilian Empire.

name: uruguay-independence
description: Uruguay gained independence as a buffer state between Argentina and Brazil following British-mediated negotiations.

name: catholic-emancipation-act
description: British law that allowed Catholics to sit in Parliament and hold most public offices for the first time since the 1600s.

name: july-revolution-france
description: Three days of revolution in Paris overthrew King Charles X and established the constitutional July Monarchy.

name: belgium-independence
description: Belgium separated from the Netherlands following a revolution, becoming an independent constitutional monarchy.

name: reform-act-1832
description: British electoral reform that expanded voting rights to middle-class men and eliminated rotten boroughs.

name: factory-act-uk
description: British law that limited child labor in textile factories and created the first factory inspectors.

name: zollverein-formed
description: German customs union that eliminated trade barriers between German states, paving the way for unification.

name: texas-revolution
description: American settlers in Texas rebelled against Mexico, leading to the famous Battle of the Alamo and Texas independence.

name: first-anesthesia-surgery
description: Crawford Long performed the first surgery using ether anesthesia, though his work wasn't published until later.

name: first-telegraph-message
description: Samuel Morse sent 'What hath God wrought' from Washington to Baltimore, demonstrating the electric telegraph.

name: texas-annexed
description: Texas joined the United States as the 28th state after nine years as an independent republic.

name: oregon-treaty
description: Treaty between the US and Britain establishing the 49th parallel as the border in the Pacific Northwest.

name: ether-anesthesia-demonstrated
description: William Morton publicly demonstrated ether anesthesia at Massachusetts General Hospital, revolutionizing surgery.

name: liberia-independence
description: Liberia declared independence, becoming Africa's first republic, founded by freed American slaves.

name: california-gold-rush
description: Discovery of gold at Sutter's Mill sparked a massive migration to California, transforming the American West.

name: revolutions-of-1848
description: Wave of revolutionary uprisings swept across Europe demanding liberal reforms and national independence.

name: compromise-of-1850
description: Series of bills that temporarily eased sectional tensions over slavery, including a stronger Fugitive Slave Act.

name: great-exhibition-opens
description: World's first international exhibition of manufactured products opened in London's Crystal Palace.

name: second-french-empire
description: Louis-Napoleon Bonaparte proclaimed himself Emperor Napoleon III, establishing the Second French Empire.

name: commodore-perry-returns-japan
description: Perry returned with a larger fleet and signed the Treaty of Kanagawa, opening Japan to American trade.

name: florence-nightingale-crimea
description: Nightingale revolutionized military nursing during the Crimean War, dramatically reducing death rates.

name: bessemer-process
description: Henry Bessemer patented an inexpensive method for mass-producing steel, enabling the industrial age.

name: dred-scott-decision
description: Supreme Court ruled that African Americans could not be citizens and Congress couldn't ban slavery in territories.

name: miracles-at-lourdes
description: Bernadette Soubirous reported visions of the Virgin Mary in Lourdes, France, creating a major pilgrimage site.

name: first-transatlantic-cable
description: First telegraph cable across the Atlantic connected Europe and North America, though it failed after weeks.

name: lincoln-douglas-debates
description: Series of seven debates between Abraham Lincoln and Stephen Douglas focused on slavery and popular sovereignty.

name: john-browns-raid
description: Abolitionist John Brown led a failed raid on Harpers Ferry armory, hoping to spark a slave rebellion.

name: south-carolina-secedes
description: South Carolina became the first state to secede from the Union following Lincoln's election.

name: emancipation-russian-serfs
description: Tsar Alexander II freed millions of Russian serfs, the largest emancipation in history at the time.

name: homestead-act
description: US law gave settlers 160 acres of public land if they farmed it for five years, spurring western expansion.

name: bismarck-becomes-minister-president
description: Otto von Bismarck became Prussia's Minister-President, beginning his campaign to unify Germany through 'blood and iron.'

name: alaska-purchase
description: United States purchased Alaska from Russia for $7.2 million, initially mocked as 'Seward's Folly.'

name: impeachment-andrew-johnson
description: President Andrew Johnson was impeached by the House but acquitted by the Senate by one vote.

name: rome-becomes-italian-capital
description: Italian forces captured Rome from the Papal States, completing Italian unification with Rome as capital.

name: standard-oil-founded
description: John D. Rockefeller founded Standard Oil, which became the largest and most powerful oil monopoly.

name: german-empire-proclaimed
description: Wilhelm I was proclaimed German Emperor at Versailles, unifying Germany under Prussian leadership.

name: treaty-of-frankfurt
description: Peace treaty ending the Franco-Prussian War, with France ceding Alsace-Lorraine to Germany.

name: yellowstone-national-park
description: World's first national park was established in Wyoming, setting a precedent for conservation worldwide.

name: monets-impression-sunrise
description: Claude Monet painted this iconic work that gave the Impressionist movement its name.

name: centennial-exhibition
description: First official World's Fair in the US celebrated America's 100th anniversary in Philadelphia.

name: serbia-independence
description: Serbia declared independence from the Ottoman Empire, later recognized at the Congress of Berlin.

name: congress-of-berlin
description: Major powers redrew Balkan boundaries after the Russo-Turkish War, creating new independent states.

name: bulgaria-independence
description: Bulgaria gained autonomy from the Ottoman Empire following the Congress of Berlin.

name: dual-alliance
description: Germany and Austria-Hungary formed a defensive alliance that would later expand into the Triple Alliance.

name: tuskegee-institute-founded
description: Booker T. Washington founded Tuskegee Institute in Alabama to provide vocational education for African Americans.

name: chinese-exclusion-act
description: First US law to ban immigration based on nationality, prohibiting Chinese laborers for ten years.

name: british-occupation-egypt
description: Britain occupied Egypt to protect the Suez Canal, beginning decades of colonial control.

name: orient-express-first-run
description: The famous luxury train made its first journey from Paris toward Constantinople.

name: haymarket-affair
description: Bombing at a Chicago labor rally killed police and workers, leading to controversial trials of anarchists.

name: dawes-act
description: US law divided tribal lands into individual allotments, undermining Native American communal land ownership.

name: brazil-abolishes-slavery
description: Brazil became the last country in the Americas to abolish slavery with the Golden Law.

name: brazil-becomes-republic
description: Military coup overthrew Emperor Pedro II, establishing the First Brazilian Republic.

name: oklahoma-land-rush
description: Thousands of settlers raced to claim land in the first Oklahoma Land Run, opening former Indian Territory.

name: sherman-antitrust-act
description: First US federal law prohibiting monopolistic business practices and promoting fair competition.

name: bismarck-dismissed
description: Kaiser Wilhelm II dismissed Chancellor Bismarck, ending the Iron Chancellor's 28-year dominance of German politics.

name: ellis-island-opens
description: Ellis Island began processing immigrants, eventually welcoming over 12 million people to America.

name: worlds-columbian-exposition
description: Chicago hosted a world's fair celebrating Columbus, featuring the first Ferris wheel and White City.

name: panic-of-1893
description: Severe economic depression caused by railroad overbuilding and bank failures, lasting four years.

name: dreyfus-affair
description: French Jewish officer Alfred Dreyfus was falsely convicted of treason, exposing deep antisemitism in France.

name: treaty-of-shimonoseki
description: Treaty ending the First Sino-Japanese War, with China ceding Taiwan and recognizing Korean independence.

name: klondike-gold-rush
description: Discovery of gold in Canada's Yukon Territory sparked a massive migration of prospectors to the region.

name: plessy-v-ferguson
description: Supreme Court upheld 'separate but equal' doctrine, legalizing racial segregation for nearly 60 years.

name: ethiopian-victory-adwa
description: Ethiopia defeated Italian forces at Adwa, preserving independence and becoming a symbol of African resistance.

name: queen-victorias-diamond-jubilee
description: Massive celebrations marked Queen Victoria's 60 years on the throne, showcasing British imperial power.

name: us-annexes-hawaii
description: United States annexed the Republic of Hawaii as a territory following the overthrow of the monarchy.

name: fashoda-incident
description: British and French forces confronted each other in Sudan, nearly causing war before France withdrew.

name: panama-independence
description: Panama declared independence from Colombia with US support, enabling construction of the Panama Canal.

name: norway-independence-sweden
description: Norway peacefully dissolved its union with Sweden, becoming an independent constitutional monarchy.

name: algeciras-conference
description: International conference resolved the First Moroccan Crisis, affirming French influence in Morocco.

name: tunguska-event
description: Massive explosion over Siberia flattened 2,000 square kilometers of forest, likely caused by a meteor.

name: young-turk-revolution
description: Military officers forced the Ottoman sultan to restore the constitution and parliament.

name: austria-annexes-bosnia
description: Austria-Hungary formally annexed Bosnia-Herzegovina, inflaming Serbian nationalism and Balkan tensions.

name: model-t-production-begins
description: Ford's affordable Model T automobile made car ownership accessible to middle-class Americans.

name: japan-annexes-korea
description: Japan formally annexed Korea, beginning 35 years of colonial rule on the peninsula.

name: union-of-south-africa
description: Four British colonies merged to form the Union of South Africa as a self-governing dominion.

name: portugal-becomes-republic
description: Republican revolution overthrew the Portuguese monarchy, establishing the First Portuguese Republic.

name: federal-reserve-created
description: US Congress established the Federal Reserve System as the nation's central bank.

name: sykes-picot-agreement
description: Secret British-French agreement divided Ottoman territories in the Middle East into spheres of influence.

name: balfour-declaration
description: British statement supporting a Jewish homeland in Palestine, shaping Middle East politics for generations.

name: february-revolution-russia
description: Popular uprising forced Tsar Nicholas II to abdicate, ending 300 years of Romanov rule in Russia.

name: zimmermann-telegram
description: German offer of alliance to Mexico against the US was intercepted, helping push America into World War I.

name: fourteen-points
description: President Wilson outlined principles for peace including self-determination and a League of Nations.

name: german-revolution-1918
description: Revolution ended the German Empire and Kaiser Wilhelm II fled, establishing the Weimar Republic.

name: czechoslovakia-founded
description: New nation emerged from the collapse of Austria-Hungary, uniting Czech and Slovak peoples.

name: munich-beer-hall-putsch
description: Hitler's failed coup attempt in Munich led to his imprisonment, where he wrote Mein Kampf.

name: time-magazine-first-issue
description: Henry Luce launched Time, America's first weekly news magazine, revolutionizing journalism.

name: scopes-trial
description: Tennessee teacher John Scopes was tried for teaching evolution, becoming a national spectacle.

name: first-five-year-plan-ussr
description: Stalin launched rapid industrialization of the Soviet Union through centralized economic planning.

name: vatican-city-created
description: Lateran Treaty established Vatican City as an independent state, ending the Roman Question.

name: black-thursday
description: Stock market crash on October 24 began the Great Depression, the worst economic crisis in modern history.

name: smoot-hawley-tariff
description: US tariff act raised import duties dramatically, worsening the Great Depression through trade wars.

name: japan-invades-manchuria
description: Japan seized Manchuria from China, creating puppet state Manchukuo and defying the League of Nations.

name: first-nazi-concentration-camps
description: Dachau and other camps opened to imprison political opponents shortly after Hitler took power.

name: us-leaves-gold-standard
description: Roosevelt took the US off the gold standard domestically to combat deflation during the Depression.

name: night-of-long-knives
description: Hitler purged SA leadership and political rivals, consolidating Nazi power through targeted murders.

name: nuremberg-laws
description: Nazi racial laws stripped German Jews of citizenship and banned marriages between Jews and non-Jews.

name: italy-invades-ethiopia
description: Mussolini's forces invaded Ethiopia, using poison gas and exposing League of Nations weakness.

name: rhineland-remilitarized
description: Germany violated Versailles by sending troops into the demilitarized Rhineland without allied response.

name: rape-of-nanking
description: Japanese forces massacred hundreds of thousands of Chinese civilians and soldiers in Nanking.

name: germany-absorbs-austria
description: Germany annexed Austria in the Anschluss, uniting the two German-speaking nations under Nazi rule.

name: nazi-soviet-pact
description: Germany and Soviet Union signed non-aggression pact with secret protocols dividing Eastern Europe.

name: blitz-begins
description: Germany began sustained bombing campaign against British cities, killing over 40,000 civilians.

name: final-solution-begins
description: Nazi Germany began systematic genocide of European Jews through death camps and mass shootings.

name: internment-japanese-americans
description: US government forcibly relocated 120,000 Japanese Americans to internment camps during World War II.

name: casablanca-conference
description: Roosevelt and Churchill met in Morocco, demanding unconditional surrender from Axis powers.

name: bretton-woods-conference
description: Allied nations established postwar monetary system with fixed exchange rates and the IMF and World Bank.

name: san-francisco-conference-un
description: Representatives from 50 nations signed the UN Charter, establishing the United Nations.

name: first-eniac-computer
description: ENIAC, the first general-purpose electronic computer, was unveiled at the University of Pennsylvania.

name: nuremberg-verdicts
description: International tribunal convicted Nazi leaders of war crimes, establishing precedent for international law.

name: truman-doctrine
description: US policy to contain communism by supporting nations resisting Soviet pressure, starting with Greece and Turkey.

name: cia-created
description: National Security Act established the Central Intelligence Agency as America's foreign intelligence service.

name: who-founded
description: World Health Organization was established as a UN agency to coordinate international public health.

name: korean-peninsula-divided
description: Separate governments were established in North and South Korea along the 38th parallel.

name: indonesia-independence
description: Netherlands recognized Indonesian independence after four years of armed struggle against colonial rule.

name: germany-divided
description: Federal Republic of Germany and German Democratic Republic were established, dividing Germany until 1990.

name: inchon-landing
description: MacArthur's amphibious landing at Inchon turned the tide of the Korean War against North Korean forces.

name: treaty-of-paris-ecsc
description: Six European nations created the European Coal and Steel Community, precursor to the European Union.

name: anzus-treaty
description: Security alliance between Australia, New Zealand, and the United States for Pacific defense.

name: egyptian-revolution-1952
description: Military coup led by Nasser overthrew King Farouk, ending British influence in Egypt.

name: montgomery-bus-boycott
description: Rosa Parks' arrest sparked a year-long boycott that desegregated Montgomery buses and launched MLK's career.

name: austrian-state-treaty
description: Treaty ended Allied occupation and restored Austrian sovereignty as a permanently neutral state.

name: de-stalinization-speech
description: Khrushchev denounced Stalin's cult of personality and crimes in a secret speech that shocked communists worldwide.

name: morocco-independence
description: Morocco gained independence from France and Spain, restoring the monarchy under Mohammed V.

name: tunisia-independence
description: Tunisia gained independence from France after nationalist movement led by Habib Bourguiba.

name: little-rock-nine
description: Nine Black students integrated Little Rock Central High School under federal troop protection.

name: fifth-french-republic
description: New constitution gave de Gaulle strong presidential powers, establishing France's current government.

name: nasa-founded
description: US created NASA to lead the space race against the Soviet Union after Sputnik's launch.

name: alaska-hawaii-statehood
description: Alaska and Hawaii became the 49th and 50th US states, completing continental expansion.

name: dalai-lama-flees-tibet
description: Dalai Lama escaped to India after failed Tibetan uprising against Chinese rule, establishing exile government.

name: antarctic-treaty
description: Twelve nations agreed to preserve Antarctica for peaceful scientific research, banning military activity.

name: u2-incident
description: Soviet Union shot down American U-2 spy plane, capturing pilot Gary Powers and escalating Cold War tensions.

name: freedom-riders
description: Civil rights activists rode buses through the South to challenge segregation, facing violent attacks.

name: peace-corps-founded
description: Kennedy established the Peace Corps to send American volunteers to developing countries.

name: algeria-independence
description: Algeria gained independence from France after eight years of brutal war, ending 132 years of colonial rule.

name: second-vatican-council
description: Pope John XXIII convened council that modernized Catholic Church, allowing Mass in local languages.

name: gulf-of-tonkin-resolution
description: Congress authorized military force in Vietnam after reported attacks on US ships, escalating the war.

name: mandela-sentenced
description: Nelson Mandela was sentenced to life imprisonment for sabotage against South Africa's apartheid government.

name: khrushchev-ousted
description: Soviet leadership removed Khrushchev from power, replacing him with Brezhnev.

name: selma-to-montgomery-march
description: Civil rights marches for voting rights faced violent opposition, leading to the Voting Rights Act.

name: immigration-act-1965
description: US law abolished national origin quotas, transforming American immigration toward Asia and Latin America.

name: miranda-v-arizona
description: Supreme Court required police to inform suspects of their rights before interrogation.

name: paris-may-events
description: Student protests and general strikes nearly toppled the French government in massive social upheaval.

name: fair-housing-act
description: US law banned discrimination in housing sales and rentals based on race, religion, or national origin.

name: nixon-doctrine
description: Nixon declared allies must take primary responsibility for their own defense while US provided support.

name: british-troops-northern-ireland
description: British Army deployed to Northern Ireland amid escalating sectarian violence beginning the Troubles.

name: kent-state-shootings
description: Ohio National Guard killed four students during anti-Vietnam War protests at Kent State University.

name: epa-created
description: Nixon established the Environmental Protection Agency to consolidate federal environmental regulation.

name: black-september
description: Jordan expelled Palestinian militants after hijackings and civil war threatened the monarchy.

name: intel-microprocessor
description: Intel released the 4004, the first commercial microprocessor chip, revolutionizing computing.

name: pentagon-papers
description: Leaked documents revealed government deception about the Vietnam War, published by the New York Times.

name: end-of-bretton-woods
description: Nixon ended dollar convertibility to gold, collapsing the fixed exchange rate system.

name: bloody-sunday-ireland
description: British soldiers killed 14 unarmed civil rights protesters in Derry, escalating the Northern Ireland conflict.

name: watergate-break-in
description: Burglars connected to Nixon's reelection campaign broke into Democratic headquarters, starting the scandal.

name: club-of-rome-report
description: Limits to Growth report warned that economic growth would deplete Earth's resources within a century.

name: oil-crisis-1973
description: Arab oil embargo quadrupled oil prices, causing economic crisis and gas shortages in Western nations.

name: opec-embargo
description: Arab OPEC members cut oil production and embargoed the US and allies supporting Israel in the Yom Kippur War.

name: uk-joins-eec
description: United Kingdom joined the European Economic Community after two earlier applications were vetoed by France.

name: carnation-revolution
description: Peaceful military coup ended decades of dictatorship in Portugal, named for flowers placed in gun barrels.

name: cyprus-divided
description: Turkish invasion following Greek coup divided Cyprus into Greek and Turkish zones that remain today.

name: microsoft-founded
description: Bill Gates and Paul Allen founded Microsoft to develop software for personal computers.

name: spanish-democracy-transition
description: Franco's death enabled Spain's transition to democracy under King Juan Carlos.

name: djibouti-independence
description: Djibouti gained independence from France, becoming the last French colony in Africa to achieve sovereignty.

name: vietnam-invades-cambodia
description: Vietnamese forces invaded Cambodia, ending the Khmer Rouge genocide and installing a new government.

name: sandinista-revolution
description: Sandinista rebels overthrew the Somoza dictatorship in Nicaragua, establishing a socialist government.

name: zimbabwe-independence
description: Rhodesia became independent Zimbabwe under Robert Mugabe, ending white minority rule.

name: sdi-announced
description: Reagan proposed the Strategic Defense Initiative to protect against nuclear missiles, dubbed Star Wars.

name: gorbachev-becomes-leader
description: Mikhail Gorbachev became Soviet leader, initiating reforms that would ultimately end the Cold War.

name: glasnost-perestroika
description: Gorbachev introduced policies of openness and restructuring to reform the Soviet system.

name: first-ozone-hole-discovered
description: Scientists discovered severe ozone depletion over Antarctica, leading to global action on CFCs.

name: people-power-revolution
description: Peaceful mass protests overthrew dictator Ferdinand Marcos, restoring democracy in the Philippines.

name: us-bombs-libya
description: Reagan ordered airstrikes on Libya in retaliation for terrorism, targeting Gaddafi directly.

name: black-monday-1987
description: Stock markets crashed worldwide on October 19, with the Dow falling 22% in a single day.

name: inf-treaty
description: US and USSR agreed to eliminate intermediate-range nuclear missiles, a major arms control achievement.

name: soviet-withdrawal-afghanistan
description: Soviet Union began withdrawing troops from Afghanistan after nine years of costly war.

name: pan-am-flight-103
description: Bombing destroyed Pan Am flight over Lockerbie, Scotland, killing 270 people in a terrorist attack.

name: velvet-revolution
description: Peaceful protests ended communist rule in Czechoslovakia, bringing Vaclav Havel to power.

name: romanian-revolution
description: Violent uprising overthrew and executed dictator Nicolae Ceausescu, ending communist rule in Romania.

name: iraq-invades-kuwait
description: Saddam Hussein's forces invaded Kuwait, leading to international coalition and the Gulf War.

name: namibia-independence
description: Namibia gained independence from South Africa after decades of armed struggle and UN involvement.

name: anc-unbanned
description: South African government lifted ban on ANC and released Nelson Mandela, beginning end of apartheid.

name: operation-desert-storm
description: US-led coalition launched air and ground campaign that liberated Kuwait from Iraqi occupation.

name: slovenia-croatia-independence
description: Slovenia and Croatia declared independence from Yugoslavia, beginning the country's violent dissolution.

name: eritrea-independence
description: Eritrea gained independence from Ethiopia after 30 years of armed struggle.

name: european-union-created
description: Maastricht Treaty transformed the European Community into the European Union with expanded powers.

name: anc-wins-election
description: Nelson Mandela and the ANC won South Africa's first democratic election, ending apartheid rule.

name: amazon-founded
description: Jeff Bezos founded Amazon as an online bookstore that would become the world's largest retailer.

name: wto-created
description: World Trade Organization was established to regulate international trade and settle disputes.

name: taliban-takes-kabul
description: Taliban captured Kabul and established the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan under strict sharia law.

name: welfare-reform-act
description: Clinton signed law that ended federal welfare guarantee and imposed work requirements on recipients.

name: blair-becomes-pm
description: Tony Blair's Labour Party won a landslide victory, ending 18 years of Conservative government in Britain.

name: monica-lewinsky-scandal
description: Clinton's affair with White House intern led to his impeachment by the House for perjury.

name: nato-kosovo-campaign
description: NATO bombed Serbia for 78 days to stop ethnic cleansing of Albanians in Kosovo.

name: east-timor-independence-vote
description: East Timor voted for independence from Indonesia, leading to violence and UN intervention.

name: putin-becomes-president
description: Vladimir Putin was elected Russian President after serving as acting president, beginning his long rule.

name: wikipedia-launched
description: Jimmy Wales launched Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia that anyone can edit.

name: us-china-spy-plane-incident
description: US spy plane collided with Chinese fighter jet and made emergency landing, creating diplomatic crisis.

name: enron-scandal
description: Energy company Enron collapsed in massive accounting fraud, costing investors billions.

name: euro-coins-circulation
description: Euro banknotes and coins replaced national currencies in 12 European countries.

name: eu-expansion-25
description: European Union admitted 10 new members, mostly from Eastern Europe, in its largest expansion.

name: orange-revolution
description: Mass protests in Ukraine overturned fraudulent election and brought pro-Western government to power.

name: angela-merkel-elected
description: Angela Merkel became Germany's first female Chancellor, leading Europe's largest economy for 16 years.

name: montenegro-independence
description: Montenegro voted for independence from Serbia, completing Yugoslavia's dissolution.

name: virginia-tech-shooting
description: Gunman killed 32 people at Virginia Tech in the deadliest school shooting in US history.

name: burma-saffron-revolution
description: Buddhist monks led mass protests against Myanmar's military junta, which violently suppressed them.

name: kosovo-independence
description: Kosovo declared independence from Serbia, recognized by many Western nations but disputed by Russia.

name: obama-inaugurated
description: Barack Obama became the first African American President of the United States.

name: wikileaks-cables
description: WikiLeaks released thousands of classified US diplomatic cables, embarrassing governments worldwide.

name: chilean-mine-rescue
description: All 33 miners trapped underground for 69 days were rescued in a dramatic televised operation.

name: egyptian-revolution-2011
description: Mass protests in Tahrir Square forced President Mubarak to resign after 30 years in power.

name: sandy-hook-shooting
description: Gunman killed 26 people, including 20 children, at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Connecticut.

name: snowden-revelations
description: NSA contractor Edward Snowden leaked classified documents revealing massive government surveillance programs.

name: scottish-independence-vote
description: Scotland voted 55% to 45% to remain part of the United Kingdom in independence referendum.

name: refugee-crisis-peak
description: Over one million refugees and migrants reached Europe, primarily fleeing Syria, creating humanitarian crisis.

name: pulse-nightclub-shooting
description: Gunman killed 49 people at gay nightclub in Orlando in deadliest US attack since 9/11.

name: trump-inauguration
description: Donald Trump was inaugurated as the 45th President after his unexpected electoral victory.

name: las-vegas-shooting
description: Gunman killed 60 people at outdoor concert from hotel room in deadliest mass shooting in US history.

name: charlottesville-rally
description: White supremacist rally in Virginia turned deadly when a car plowed into counter-protesters.

name: us-north-korea-summit
description: Trump and Kim Jong Un held historic first meeting between US and North Korean leaders in Singapore.

name: yellow-vest-protests
description: French protests against fuel taxes and economic inequality spread nationwide, forcing government concessions.

name: boris-johnson-becomes-pm
description: Boris Johnson became Prime Minister pledging to deliver Brexit after Theresa May's resignation.

name: greta-thunberg-un-speech
description: Teenage climate activist addressed the UN, accusing world leaders of stealing her future with inaction.

name: george-floyd-protests
description: Floyd's death sparked worldwide protests against police brutality and racial injustice.

name: biden-elected
description: Joe Biden defeated Donald Trump to become the 46th President of the United States.

name: us-withdrawal-afghanistan
description: US completed chaotic withdrawal from Afghanistan after 20 years of war, with Taliban rapidly taking control.

name: cop26-glasgow
description: UN climate conference in Glasgow produced agreements on coal, methane, and deforestation.

name: taliban-return-to-power
description: Taliban seized Kabul as US withdrew, restoring Islamic Emirate twenty years after its overthrow.

name: iran-protests-2022
description: Death of Mahsa Amini in morality police custody sparked nationwide protests against the Islamic Republic.

name: pelosi-taiwan-visit
description: House Speaker Pelosi's visit to Taiwan provoked Chinese military exercises and heightened tensions.

name: ai-rapid-advancement-gpt4
description: OpenAI released GPT-4, sparking global debate about AI capabilities, safety, and regulation.
